text: is a Japanese city in Nagasaki Prefecture.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "HIrado" in Japan Encyclopedia, pp. 314-315. ==History== Hirado has been a port since the Nara period. During the Edo period, Hirado was the seat of the Hirado Domain. The city developed around Hirado Castle (Hirado-jō). The first Frenchman to arrive in Japan was Francis Caron. He live in Hirado. ==Geography== The city is located on the island of the same name; and it has expanded to the island of Kyūshū. The two parts of the city are connected by the Hirado Bridge which was built in 1977. ==References== ==Other websites== * http://www.city.hirado.nagasaki.jp/english/home.htm ; * American Friendship Doll at Hirado Kindergarten Category:Cities in Nagasaki Prefecture
